item.title: Hardening Edge Infrastructure: pfSense & VLAN Segmentation
item.description:
Infrastructure Layout

To maintain OPSEC and isolate exploit testing, I’ve implemented a multi-VLAN structure.

  • VLAN 10 (Management): Isolated for primary workstations.
  • VLAN 20 (Lab): Where the “vulnerable” targets live.
  • VLAN 30 (Red): Dedicated for C2 traffic and egress testing.

Firewall Rules

Rules are configured on a Deny-by-Default basis. Only specific ports are mirrored to the IDS for traffic analysis.

item.title: Operation: Redacted - From SSRF to Internal Metadata Access
item.description:
Executive Summary

During a routine reconnaissance phase on a private bug bounty program, I identified an Out-of-Band SSRF vulnerability in the PDF generation engine.

The Chain

  1. Discovery: Identified an endpoint /api/v1/generate accepting a source_url parameter.
  2. Bypass: Used a DNS rebinding technique to bypass the internal IP blacklist.
  3. Impact: Successfully retrieved AWS metadata credentials from 169.254.169.254.
# Example payload used
curl -X POST [https://target.com/api/v1/generate?source_url=http://](https://target.com/api/v1/generate?source_url=http://)[redacted].com/metadata

item.title: About Me
item.description:
The Journey

My path into cybersecurity didn’t start with a tutorial on “how to hack.” It started with a terminal, managing servers, and troubleshooting network loops. My background as a Sysadmin taught me how production environments actually breathe, which now gives me a unique advantage in offensive security: I know what the logs look like on the other side.

The Vision

My objective is the mastery of End-to-End Offensive Operations. I am building toward becoming a well-rounded Red Teamer capable of moving from initial reconnaissance to deep exploitation and impact. I focus on understanding the underlying physics of a network—how data moves and where trust is misplaced—rather than just running automated scripts.

Philosophy & Interests

I operate on the principle of deep focus. I value non-generic knowledge and the pursuit of technical depth.

  • Stoicism
  • J.R.R. Tolkien

“You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.” — Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Technical Stack
